definition: to stir up trouble
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
is/are/am/yes/to be
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: My brother is ill-tempered, and always stirs up trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我弟弟的脾氣很暴躁，常惹是生非。

sentences.english: I’ve always tried to stay out of trouble so they never have to.
sentences.chinese: 我也一直試着不去惹是生非，所以他們也省事了。

sentences.english: My brother is ill-tempered , and likes to stir up trouble outside.
sentences.chinese: 我弟弟的脾氣很暴躁，常喜歡在外面惹是生非。

sentences.english: His irreverence for authority marks him out as a troublemaker.
sentences.chinese: 他對權威的不敬使他成了一個惹是生非的刺兒頭。

sentences.english: My brother is ill-tempered, and always stirs up trouble .
sentences.chinese: 我弟弟的脾氣很暴躁，常惹是生非。

definition: variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
to cause trouble

to stir up trouble/to get into trouble
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
